title: How plants feed
subject_group: Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Plant physiology
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Plant breeding
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Natural history
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Plant cells and tissue
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Plant-soil relationships
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Microcinematography
description: A study of how plants obtain the elements necessary for their existence from the air and from the soil. Microcinematography and animation are used to show how, through their roots and leaves, plants absorb nourishment from the air and the soil, and how crystals are formed in the plant cells from concentrated solutions of certian substances.
